thread.title: A Book BofA and Citi Can't Pick Up
thread.title_full: A Book BofA and Citi Can't Pick Up

title: A Book BofA and Citi Can't Pick Up
text:
Heard on the Street A Book BofA and Citi Can’t Pick Up It has been nearly seven years since shares of Bank of America or Citigroup traded above book value By July 26, 2015 2:18 p.m. ET 
Bank of America and Citigroup should be getting the seven-year itch. 
In about two months, the two banks will face a dubious milestone: It will have been seven years since shares in either traded above book value. That is something for BofA’s newly named finance chief, Paul Donofrio, to contemplate as he takes the reins from Bruce Thompson , who the bank just said would depart after four years in the role. 
That neither banks’... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
